keyPolicies.policyDescription: Against the new homes tax proposed by Corbyn’s policies.
Opposes free tuition fees for all students under Corbyn’s policies.
Critiques financial transaction tax and opposes putting politicians in charge of key industries as proposed by Corbyn.
Against the idea of putting politicians in charge of energy and water companies.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The Conservatives were only nine seats short of a majority last time so tactical voting is important to secure a majority government.

issues.brexitEurope: More arguing about Brexit and no action on our priorities mentioned in the context of Corbyn’s policies.
issues.economy: Criticizes Corbyn’s policies for their cost to the country and mentions jobs lost, uncertainty for businesses, and gridlock in parliament.
issues.governance: Criticizes Corbyn’s approach to involving politicians in the administration of rail, energy, water, and postal services.
issues.health: Mentions the impact of a four-day week on vital public services like the NHS.

housing.content: New homes tax on EVERY home

images.caption: Your bill for the cost of Corbyn
Politicians in charge of water and energy supplies

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet critiques the financial impact of Jeremy Corbyn’s policies and encourages voting for Alan Bell to avoid those costs.
